title: What is tokenization?

children.text: Tokenization is the process of converting ownership or participation rights in a real-world asset — such as equity, debt, or revenue share — into a digital security token recorded on a blockchain. Each token represents a verified, auditable share in the underlying asset.

title: How does tokenization benefit investors?

children.text: Tokenization creates fractional ownership, enables faster settlement, and opens access to secondary markets that were traditionally illiquid. Investors can trade or transfer their positions securely while maintaining full regulatory compliance.

title: What assets can be tokenized through Equilibria?

children.text: Equilibria tokenizes a diverse range of assets including:
Private-company equity and convertible notes
Real-estate assets and revenue-sharing contracts
Fund interests (VC, PE, or SPVs)
Media, IP, and technology ventures

title: Is tokenization the same as cryptocurrency?

children.text: No. Equilibria's tokens are digital securities, not cryptocurrencies. They represent regulated ownership rights and are issued under U.S. Securities Act exemptions (Reg D, Reg S, or Reg A+).

title: Where are my tokens held?

children.text: Tokens are custodied in regulated digital-asset wallets partnered with licensed transfer agents, custodians, or ATS platforms such as Securitize, INX, or DIGTL.

title: What is Regulation D?

children.text: Reg D (Rule 506(b)/(c)) allows companies to raise capital from accredited investors without full SEC registration.
Investors must meet income or net-worth thresholds.
Tokens issued under Reg D are generally restricted for 12 months before resale.

title: What is Regulation S?

children.text: Reg S allows offerings outside the United States to non-U.S. persons.
Investors must certify they are not U.S. residents.
Tokens may be listed on international exchanges once the distribution compliance period ends.

title: What is Regulation A+?

children.text: Reg A+ Tier II permits public fundraising from both accredited and non-accredited investors (up to $75 million per year).
Offerings require SEC qualification and audited financials.
Tokens can be freely traded once issued, subject to KYC/AML.

title: Can a company use multiple exemptions at once?

children.text: Yes. Many issuers structure dual offerings — e.g., Reg D + Reg S — to include both U.S. and international investors while maintaining legal separation and reporting integrity.

title: How does KYC/AML work on Equilibria?

children.text: All investors complete a digital verification process including:
ID and residency checks;
Source-of-funds review;
Accreditation or eligibility certification.
This process satisfies FinCEN, FATF, GDPR, and QFC/DIFC requirements.

title: Is my information secure?

children.text: Yes. Equilibria uses AES-256 encryption, hardware-secured wallets, and ISO 27001-compliant infrastructure to ensure confidentiality and integrity.

title: What are AI agents within Equilibria?

children.text: Equilibria employs autonomous AI agents that manage investor relations, compliance monitoring, and data intelligence. These systems are not chatbots — they're machine-learning modules trained to execute secure, compliant marketing and engagement tasks.

title: How do AI agents enhance the investor experience?

children.text: AI agents provide multiple benefits:
Personalized communication:
Tailored briefings and investment summaries.
Predictive matching:
AI identifies investors most aligned with specific offerings.
Compliance assurance:
Real-time screening ensures all communications meet securities-law language requirements.

title: Are AI agents supervised?

children.text: Yes. Every AI workflow includes human-in-the-loop review and audit logging to preserve full regulatory traceability.

title: What is the Equilibria Investor Database?

children.text: Equilibria manages a verified database of 4,615 contacts across 2,606 organizations spanning real estate, technology, manufacturing, fintech, energy, healthcare, media, hospitality, and automotive sectors.

title: How is AI used in investor marketing?

children.text: AI agents segment investors by:
Industry focus, geography, and deal size;
Historical engagement patterns;
Regulatory eligibility (accredited, institutional, or international).
The system automates outreach while maintaining GDPR and U.S. CAN-SPAM compliance.

title: Is my contact data shared externally?

children.text: No. Investor data remains confidential and is never sold or shared outside authorized intermediaries or compliance partners. Data use strictly follows Equilibria's Privacy Policy and applicable data-protection laws.

title: What are the benefits of AI-based investor targeting?

children.text: AI-based targeting provides three key advantages:
Efficiency:
Reduces manual research and administrative time.
Precision:
Matches the right investors to the right deals.
Transparency:
Every campaign is logged for compliance and analytics.

title: How can I invest through Equilibria?

children.text: Investing through Equilibria is a simple four-step process:
Join
– Create an Equilibria account and digital wallet.
Verify
– Complete KYC/AML and accreditation checks.
Invest
– Select offerings that match your profile.
Trade
– Access secondary markets for liquidity.

title: Who regulates Equilibria's operations?

children.text: Equilibria operates under partnerships with licensed broker-dealers, transfer agents, and ATS platforms, ensuring compliance with SEC, FINRA, ESMA, and GCC CMA standards.

title: How do I contact support or compliance?

children.text: You can reach our support and compliance teams through:
Email:
support@equilibria.net
or
compliance@equilibria.net
Response times: typically within 24 hours (business days).
